text: this is jimmy wang reporting from
beijing with the global economic
slowdown taking hold all over the world
analysts have looked to China in the
hopes that increases in spending by
Chinese consumers will help drive the
world economy I visited a variety of
neighborhoods in Beijing to see if
people here have continued to spend
money and if so on what shufu cheese
sells fruit in a working-class community
in downtown Beijing does that gonna do
me 10 there are much fewer people buying
than before people don't want to part
with their money my cost of living isn't
very high so there hasn't been a huge
effect on me yet still nowadays I don't
buy much at all especially expensive
things I cook my own food and don't
really go out and go even know Kanye so
yeah the shoulder of Allah don't ever
show that number of hours I work has
been cut so my salary isn't as high as
it was before I work in an assembly line
in a car manufacturing plant I've talked
about this financial crisis with my
friends we all feel our income is too
low and things are unaffordable I find
it unacceptable what I'm a lot while
working class Chinese and Margaret
workers are tightening their belts the
newly minted middle class continues to
spend on low ticket items such as
clothing and food at a mall nearby a
trendy coffee shop charging as much as
six dollars for a cup of coffee was full
of people what's I'm going to the time
so straightest m fancy
I've lost about a third of the money I
had in real estate in stocks but it's
all on paper my lifestyle hasn't been
affected I don't spend more or less
money most of the money i do spends on
my son's education like most chinese
households we spend about fifty percent
of her income paying for my son's
tuition and schooling fees the younger
generation is definitely different you
tend to use more credit cards and don't
save quite as much I think amongst other
Chinese there's a proclivity to save
because we have to have enough money to
take care of our parents and any
problems that might arise our parents
get sick for example we have to pay for
it out of our own pockets so you must
plan for contingencies like this the
debilitating cost of education combined
with the lack of an adequate social
safety net in China has meant that even
while there are more young Chinese with
disposable incomes to spend than ever
before on average Chinese continue to
have one of the highest savings rates in
the world
